messages.message: Hi, is there a way to get the flow start time in the post flow udf, apart from enabling run id and getting the timestamp from output folder name?
You can get it from flow dashboard: https://instabase.com/apps/flow/dashboard/
Right, I need it in UDF, and I will prefer to avoid making an api call.
Can I get output directories creation time?
Oh ok. Sorry, I missed the "in post flow udf" for some reason :sweat_smile:.

Looked into it a bit, The run-id in output folder is just the time for which the flow context is being created and we aren’t storing that value: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/aff28e652fa930cf2eeafe0da47808ab9953c7[…]lib/src/py/instabase/flow_signature_lib/common/flow_sig_util.py (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/aff28e652fa930cf2eeafe0da47808ab9953c783/shared-utils/py-utils/flow/client/flow-signature-lib/src/py/instabase/flow_signature_lib/common/flow_sig_util.py#L27)

I think your best bet would be to get it from the job timeline. Unfortunately I don’t really know how to access it from a udf, or if it is accessible at all :disappointed:.
Could you just save `time.time()`in a pre-flow UDF?
yes, I ended up doing something like that
